The protection of religious belief and practice is enshrined in our Constitution’s First Amendment.
The government cannot justify trampling religious freedom when alternatives to accomplish its goal already exist.
They – not the government – are the best guide for what violates those principles.
The people who serve in these ministries have dedicated their lives to living out their religious convictions
But neither religious belief nor practice ends at the threshold of a house of worship.
That means nearly all faith-based charities, schools & hospitals are not exempt because they serve &/or employ people of other faiths.
There is a very narrow religious exemption, but the federal government has consistently refused to extend it beyond houses of worship.
